skill.name: generate-image
skill.description: Generate or edit images using AI models (FLUX, Gemini). Use for general-purpose image generation including photos, illustrations, artwork, visual assets, concept art, and any image that isn't a technical diagram or schematic. For flowcharts, circuits, pathways, and technical diagrams, use the scientific-schematics skill instead.
skill.summary: Generate or edit images using AI models (FLUX, Gemini). Use for general-purpose image generation inc...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate image generation script. It reads a local .env file for the OpenRouter API key and sends prompts and optional images to the documented OpenRouter endpoint. No credential harvesting, persistence mechanisms, or execution of external code was found. The code behavior matches its stated purpose.

content.value_statement: You need fast, high quality images or edits for content and documents. This skill sends your prompt and optional image to OpenRouter and saves the result as a PNG file.
actual_capabilities: Generate images from a text prompt using OpenRouter models
Edit an existing image using a prompt and input file
Select OpenRouter model by ID including FLUX.2 Pro and Gemini 3 Pro
Save the first returned image to a chosen output path
Read OPENROUTER_API_KEY from a local .env file
Support multiple image formats for editing: PNG, JPEG, GIF, WebP
limitations: Requires a valid OpenRouter API key to function
Needs network access to openrouter.ai API endpoint
Edits only supported input formats: PNG, JPEG, GIF, WebP
Saves only the first image returned by the API

use_cases.title: Create concept figures
use_cases.description: Generate illustrative visuals for papers, slides, or posters without drawing skills.

use_cases.title: Iterate visual ideas
use_cases.description: Explore variations and edits on a base image for faster ideation and iteration.

use_cases.title: Enhance documentation
use_cases.description: Add clear visual assets to guides, manuals, and internal documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Simple generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a clean, photorealistic image of a modern laboratory workspace with natural light.

prompt_templates.title: Styled illustration
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an illustration of a DNA helix in a minimalist flat style with blue and teal colors.

prompt_templates.title: Targeted edit
prompt_templates.prompt: Edit the input image to change the background to a soft gradient and add subtle bokeh lights.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced model choice
prompt_templates.scenario: Use a specific model for quality
prompt_templates.prompt: Use model black-forest-labs/flux.2-pro to generate a cinematic city skyline at sunset with dramatic clouds.

output_examples.input: Generate a futuristic AI brain concept with glowing neural networks.
output: Resolution and style reflect the prompt description

best_practices: Provide specific visual details and style cues in your prompt
Use editing prompts that reference specific elements in the image
Set a custom output path to avoid overwriting previous generated images
anti_patterns: Using it for technical diagrams or flowcharts (use scientific-schematics instead)
Running without setting OPENROUTER_API_KEY in .env file
Expecting multiple images from a single generation run

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude and Codex?
faq.answer: Yes, it is a standalone Python script that works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code workflows.

faq.question: What are the model limits?
faq.answer: Limits depend on the OpenRouter model and your account quota on openrouter.ai.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into a pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, call the script from another tool and pass prompt, model, and output path arguments.

faq.question: Is my data sent anywhere else?
faq.answer: Only your prompt and optional image are sent to OpenRouter for AI image generation.

faq.question: What if I get an API error?
faq.answer: Check your API key validity, model name accuracy, and network access, then retry.

faq.question: How does it compare to scientific-schematics?
faq.answer: This skill creates photos and artwork while scientific-schematics creates technical diagrams like flowcharts.
